Directives > ui-heat-map

Heat Map


Basic Heat map overlaid on a container element.
			
<ui-heat-map container-id="heatMap" opacity="0.75" radius="30" gradient="gradientData1" data="heatMapData1" get-coordinates="getData" domain="domain"></ui-heat-map>
Example:
gradientData1:[{'0.4':'aqua','.5': 'green','.8': 'yellow','.95': 'red'}]
heatMapData1:{max:120,data:[{x: 60, y: 30, value: 120},{x: 130, y: 80, value: 120,radius:10}]}
domain:{width:1000, height: 400}

Heat Map with random data and radius

			
<ui-heat-map container-id="heatMapCustomized" opacity="0.8" radius="20" gradient="gradientData2" data="heapMapData2" ></ui-heat-map>
Example:
gradientData2:[{ '.5': 'yellow','.8': 'red','.95': 'blue','.6':'aqua'}]

ui-heat-map attributes

Name type description
container-id string This is a required feild. The value for this field should be the same as the value of the id of the div on which the heat map is to be overlayed.
opacity string set the global opacity for the whole heatmap. The range of values can be from 0 to 1.
radius string set the radius of the heat map points generated.
gradient JSON model The the gradient and the colors of the heat map can be manually set in the controller and then bound to the heatmap.
$scope.gradientData1 = { '0.4' : 'aqua', '.5' : 'green', '.8' : 'yellow', '.95' : 'red' };
domain JSON model Set the domain of data that is passed to the control.
$scope.domain = { width: 1000, height: 400 }
If provided, the "x" and "y" values of "data" attribute are considered as part the domain. The generated heat map will be scaled from this domain to the containing element (container) width and height.
data JSON model The data for the heat points to be generated is bound to the heatmap.
$scope.heatMapData1 ={ max:120, data:[{ x : 120, y : 50, value : 120 }, { x : 200, y : 100, value : 120, radius:10 }]};
The data has to be supplied in the same format mentioned above. The "radius" field is optional, however the other fields "max", "x", "y", "value" are mandatory
on-click function on-click is a callback function, which returns the click co-ordinates and the value for the corresponding co-ordinates. The click co-ordinates returned are with respect to the heat map container/div and not the viewport. The callback function returns a JSON object containing {offSetX, offSetY, value}.
